conclusion: Need to analyze the given information and the relationship between acceleration and time to determine if objects have the same velocity at time t1.
The graph shows the acceleration of both objects as a function of time.
The graph is a straight line, indicating a constant acceleration for both objects.
The graph shows that the acceleration of object A is a_A and the acceleration of object B is a_B.
Since the graph is a straight line, the acceleration is constant for both objects.
The velocity of an object is the derivative of its position with respect to time.
For object A, the velocity v_A at time t1 can be calculated as v_A = a_A * t1.
For object B, the velocity v_B at time t1 can be calculated as v_B = a_B * t1.
Since the acceleration is constant for both objects, the velocity is directly proportional to the time.
The velocity of object A at time t1 is equal to the velocity of object B at time t1.
At time t1, the two objects have the same velocity.
